alert.note: Alert for Clinch; Southern Ware; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 9:18PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Nassau, Bradford, Baker, eastern Union, western Clay, southwestern Duval, southeastern Ware, southeastern Clinch and central Charlton Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 917 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Stephen Foster State Park to near Macclenny to 8 miles southwest of Sampson. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Starke, Lake Butler, Keystone Heights, Fargo, Raiford, Stephen Foster State Park, Middleburg, Taylor, Macclenny and Glen St. Mary. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
